item.title: 2023 RI Retreat
item.description: Profiling of the epigenetic landscape of regenerative and non-regenerative mouse cardiomyocytes Authors Jielin Yang Amaury Aguilar Jibran Syed Paul Delgado-Olguin Abstract The mammalian heart remains one of the least regenerative tissues. However, the mouse heart exhibits a remarkable regenerative capacity at postnatal day 0 (P0), contrasting with the diminished regenerative potential observed at postnatal day 7 (P7). This transition aligns with the process of cardiomyocyte maturation, during which cardiomyocytes are characterized by hypertrophic growth, sarcomere organization, enhanced metabolic activity, and cell cycle exit.
